snippet: On the occasion of the first issue of The Oxford American under its new editorship, a critic hopes that the future of this Southern literary quarterly will live up to its estimable past.
abstract: Dwight Garner looks at first issue of Oxford American under its new editor Roger D Hodge, who took over after founder Marc Smirnoff was fired after being accused of sexual harassment; offers hope that future of this acclaimed Southern literary quarterly will live up to its estimable past.
lead_paragraph: On the occasion of the first issue of The Oxford American under its new editorship, a critic hopes that the future of this Southern literary quarterly will live up to its estimable past.

headline.seo: Oxford American, Hail to Literary Magazine’s Past and Future
headline.main: It Was The New Yorker With Hot Sauce
headline.print_headline: It Was The New Yorker With Hot Sauce
